vitamins.title: Arduino Pro Mini Pins on top, inc serial pins
Arduino Pro Mini Pins on top, inc serial pins

steps.desc: Plug the Pro Mini Clips into the base and then snap the Arduino Pro Mini into them
Connect the two bumper assemblies using four of the push pins with flat heads
Plug the two wheels assemblies into the base
Connect the jumper wires between the motor drivers and the Arduino
Fix the power toggle switch into place
Align the caster assembly with the base, then insert a short pin to lock it to the base
Attach the battery pack with self-adhesive hook and loop tape
Wire in the terminal block to distribute power

Wire up power to the stepper drivers and Arduino.  Then connect the microswitches to the Arduino. 
            Refer to the following wiring for Arduino pin connections: 
            ![Arduino Wiring Diagram](../images/ArduinoWiringDiagram.png)
Push the shell down onto the base and twist to lock into place
Place the Microswitches into the holders.  Make sure to get them the right way round so the bumper hits the metal lever.  Repeat for the second bumper.
Clip the motor into place
Push the pins into the motor clip
Push the wheel onto the motor shaft, then add a rubber band or o-ring to the wheel for extra grip.  You can also add a retaining grub screw if necessary.
Slide the stepper driver into place and plug in the cable for the motor
Clip the motor into place
Push the pins into the motor clip
Push the wheel onto the motor shaft, then add a rubber band or o-ring to the wheel for extra grip.  You can also add a retaining grub screw if necessary.
Slide the stepper driver into place and plug in the cable for the motor
Insert the marble into the printed housing
Clip the lid onto the top of the shell

markdown.markdown: The base requires a well calibrated printer to avoid adhesion issues.  You may also need to ream the holes to 7mm, depending on your print tolerances.
Orient to print on the flat side, no brim.  You may need to sand the flat sides depending on the tolerances of your printer.
MotorClips need re-orienting before printing so that the base of the motor clip sits on the bed
Orient to print on the flat side, no brim.  You may need to sand the flat sides depending on the tolerances of your printer.
MotorClips need re-orienting before printing so that the base of the motor clip sits on the bed
Orient to print upside down for best results.  No support required.  A brim may help with bed adhesion and would not need to removed after printing.  Ream the pin hole to 7mm if necessary.
Orient to print on the flat side, no brim.  You may need to sand the flat sides depending on the tolerances of your printer.
The shell has a maximum overhang of 60 degrees and should print without support on most printers
Includes built-in support material which should easily break out after printing

vitamins.title: Arduino Pro Mini Pins on top, inc serial pins
Arduino Pro Mini Pins on top, inc serial pins

steps.desc: Plug the Pro Mini Clips into the base and then snap the Arduino Pro Mini into them
Connect the two bumper assemblies using four of the push pins with flat heads
Plug the two wheels assemblies into the base
Connect the jumper wires between the motor drivers and the Arduino
Fix the power toggle switch into place
Align the caster assembly with the base, then insert a short pin to lock it to the base
Fix the servo bracket assembly into place using two pins
Attach the battery pack with self-adhesive hook and loop tape
Wire in the terminal block to distribute power

Wire up power to the stepper drivers and Arduino.  Then connect the microswitches to the Arduino. 
            Refer to the following wiring for Arduino pin connections: 
            ![Arduino Wiring Diagram](../images/ArduinoWiringDiagram.png)
Push the shell down onto the base and twist to lock into place
Push fit the servo into the bracket, thereby fixing the lid in place
Place the Microswitches into the holders.  Make sure to get them the right way round so the bumper hits the metal lever.  Repeat for the second bumper.
Clip the motor into place
Push the pins into the motor clip
Push the wheel onto the motor shaft, then add a rubber band or o-ring to the wheel for extra grip.  You can also add a retaining grub screw if necessary.
Slide the stepper driver into place and plug in the cable for the motor
Clip the motor into place
Push the pins into the motor clip
Push the wheel onto the motor shaft, then add a rubber band or o-ring to the wheel for extra grip.  You can also add a retaining grub screw if necessary.
Slide the stepper driver into place and plug in the cable for the motor
Insert the marble into the printed housing
Push fit the micro servo horn into the base of the lid
Fit the distance sensor into the top of the shell, threading the cable down through the lid

vitamins.title: Arduino Pro Mini Pins on top, inc serial pins
Arduino Pro Mini Pins on top, inc serial pins

steps.desc: Cut a piece of wood to 500mm long, at least 20mm x 20mm cross section
Screw the capstan assemblies to the wooden beam, the axles should be 440mm apart.
String up the gondola using fishing line
Fix the arduino to the center of the beam - 200mm jumper wires should just reach from the motor drivers
Screw, tape or otherwise fix the polargraph onto the top of a suitable drawing surface - flipchart stands work well.
Clip the motor into place
Push the capstan onto the motor shaft.  You can also add a retaining grub screw if necessary.
Slide the stepper driver into place and plug in the cable for the motor
Clip the motor into place
Push the capstan onto the motor shaft.  You can also add a retaining grub screw if necessary.
Slide the stepper driver into place and plug in the cable for the motor
Attach the pen lift
Attach the three castors

Place the pen holder into the pen slider plate.  Ensure they move freely, the two parts should fall apart easily.  Lightly file or sand the pen holder part if they dont.  Fit an elastic band in the lower grooves and over the top of the mechanism so that it pulls the pen holder down in the slider mechanism.

Use a small elastic band to securely fasten the pen to the holder.  Make sure that the pen is held vertically and that the nib of the pen will be touching the ground when the slider is almost, but not quite, fully down.
Insert the marble into the printed housing

markdown.markdown: MotorClips need re-orienting before printing so that the base of the motor clip sits on the bed
MotorClips need re-orienting before printing so that the base of the motor clip sits on the bed
The base requires a well calibrated printer to avoid adhesion issues.  You may also need to ream the holes to 7mm, depending on your print tolerances.
Slider will probably require some sanding to get a smooth fit into the holder.  A bit of silicon spray lubricant may also help.
You may need to ream the pin holes to 7mm, depending on your print tolerances
Orient to print on the flat side, no brim.  You may need to sand the flat sides depending on the tolerances of your printer.
Orient to print upside down for best results.  No support required.  A brim may help with bed adhesion and would not need to removed after printing.  Ream the pin hole to 7mm if necessary.

children.markdown: Slider will probably require some sanding to get a smooth fit into the holder.  A bit of silicon spray lubricant may also help.
You may need to ream the pin holes to 7mm, depending on your print tolerances

children.desc: Place the pen holder into the pen slider plate.  Ensure they move freely, the two parts should fall apart easily.  Lightly file or sand the pen holder part if they dont.  Fit an elastic band in the lower grooves and over the top of the mechanism so that it pulls the pen holder down in the slider mechanism.

Use a small elastic band to securely fasten the pen to the holder.  Make sure that the pen is held vertically and that the nib of the pen will be touching the ground when the slider is almost, but not quite, fully down.

children.markdown: Orient to print on the flat side, no brim.  You may need to sand the flat sides depending on the tolerances of your printer.
Orient to print on the flat side, no brim.  You may need to sand the flat sides depending on the tolerances of your printer.

children.desc: Fit the pen lift assembly using two of the pins and zip tie the servo under the base.
Attach the battery pack with self-adhesive hook and loop tape
Wire in the terminal block to distribute power

Wire up power to the stepper drivers and Arduino.  Then connect the microswitches to the Arduino. 
            Refer to the following wiring for Arduino pin connections: 
            ![Arduino Wiring Diagram](../images/ArduinoWiringDiagram.png)

children.markdown: The shell has a maximum overhang of 60 degrees and should print without support on most printers

children.desc: Push the shell down onto the base and twist to lock into place

markdown.markdown: The base requires a well calibrated printer to avoid adhesion issues.  You may also need to ream the holes to 7mm, depending on your print tolerances.
